intro: Scalesia helleri subsp. santacruzensis, commonly known as the Santa Cruz scaleia, is a member of the Asteraceae family and is native to the Galápagos Islands. It is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in terminal clusters, attracting pollinators such as birds and insects. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This subspecies is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of its volcanic habitat, showcasing the adaptive diversity of the Scalesia genus.
